quote: Station Log.  Stardate 46925.1.  We    have been honored with a visit by a    delegation of Federation ambassadors    on a "fact-finding" mission to the    wormhole.  Fortunately I have just    the officer to take them off my hands.
I wish there was something I could    do, Ambassador but...
Madame ambassador...
Madame ambassador... unfortunately,    all the guest quarters on the station    are roughly the same size...
Then move me to the crew level.
All the quarters on the crew level    are currently occupied...
Then someone can move... you, for    example...
She did the same thing during the    voyage here.  She's never satisfied...
At least I didn't bother the Captain    every hour with some new suggestion    on how to run his ship...
He welcomed my suggestions... as I'm    sure your Commander Sisko will welcome    them...       ... if we ever get to spend any time    with him.
Commander Sisko is extremely busy...
With what?
With...       ... the recalibration sweep.
What are you recalibrating?
...Everything.  It's a... sweeping...    recalibration of all systems...
I cannot speak for the others, but I    would be fascinated to observe this    recalibration, Doctor.
You... would?  After your long trip,    I was thinking perhaps you all might    enjoy stopping by a holosuite... ?
Are you actually suggesting we indulge    in one of those disgusting Ferengi    sex programs?
No... I... the holosuites are capable    of creating many different...
Of course that was what he was    suggesting.       The Arbazan are so sexually    repressed...
This is outrageous.
Perhaps we should... all... just get    some rest then...
I did not come all this way to rest,    Doctor.  I would like to see your    facility.
A first-year officer assigned as our    liaison.  Starfleet command will    hear of this...
Ambassador... Madame ambassador, I'm    only...
It's gone!  It's gone!
What's gone, Madame Ambassador?
My latinum hairbrooch.
Quark!
I'd just made a third straight cross    and I leaned over the table to pick    up the dice again and I felt someone    brush against me... my God, I've    been wigged...
What's the problem here?
Someone has stolen Ambassador Troi's    latinum hairbrooch.
I'm sorry but as the sign says...    the establishment is not responsible    for the loss of any personal items...
Sign?  What sign?
The one above the door.
You'd have to stand on the bar to    read it...
Rules of the house.  I'm very sorry.     Have a nice day.
You're dealing with the daughter of    the fifth house, keeper of the chalice    of Rixx, heir to the holy rings of    Betazed...
Aah!  Not my ear, please...
Yes, I know where it hurts the most,    you little troll.  Now, I want this    room sealed and everyone strip-   searched until my brooch...
May I be of service?
Yes, thank goodness.       Our security chief, Odo.
What seems to be the problem?
My hairbrooch has been stolen, it's    been in my family for thirty-six    generations, it's absolutely    priceless, and I want it back.
You're certain you were wearing it    today.
Of course, I'm certain.  I never use    this hair without it.
I see.       You're Betazoid?
Of course.
Telepathic.
Yes.
And you sense no guilt anywhere in    this room?
No, but Betazoids can't read...    Ferengis...
Quark has plenty of reasons to feel    guilty, but he usually doesn't have    to resort to petty theft to fleece    his clients.
Thank you.
Empty your pockets.
Now!
Since when did you join Starfleet?
Hey, that's my earring...
That's it... that's my brooch.
But how did you know?
Dopterians are distant relatives of    the Ferengi... it made sense that if    you couldn't read Quark, you might    not be able to read this charming    fellow either.
How perfectly brilliant of you.
Doctor, I want to know everything    there is to know about your security    chief...
Computer, is the diagnostic on the    fusion powerplant finished yet?
Affirmative.  The fusion powerplant    is operating within normal    parameters...
What are you talking about...       It's thirteen percent below normal.
Cardassian specifications accept    operating efficiency within twenty    percent.
Well, I don't.       Anara...
Yessir.
How much do you know about the carbon    reaction chambers... ?
I've learned a little about laser-   induced fusion... not much more than    the basics...

It's a bloody inefficient system and    if I could, I'd trade it in for a    Federation model tomorrow.  But it's    all we've got.  Do me a favor and    just keep an eye on the exhaust plasma    temperature...
Computer, increase deuterium flow by    five percent to reaction chamber    two...
Procedure is not recommended.
Listen, I've had enough of your    opinions, computer, just do it.
Procedure is not recommended.  Consult    Cardassian operational guidelines,    paragraph two-fifty-four-A, now on    screen.
I don't want to read your tech manual,    dammit.  Fine.  We'll do it ourselves.
Re-initializing reactor two...    directing plasma stream to conduits    one forty-three... one-forty-four...    and one forty --
What?  Computer, analyze reactor two    failure...
Reactor two was shut down after    sensors detected a potential overload    of the carbon reaction chambers.
That's it.  That's the straw.
Relax, Chief.  It's just a computer.
She's no computer, sir.  She's my    arch enemy.
You've got it working just fine, as    far as I can tell.

Fine?  Commander, with all due    respect, as an engineer, I couldn't    look at myself in the mirror if I    let this computer continue to perform    as it does now.  I really need to do    a root canal.
Root canal?
Engineering shorthand, sir.  I'm    gonna have to get into her guts and    rebuild her from the ground up.
How long will that take?
Well, I'm still not all that familiar    with Cardassian technology... but    I'd guess no more than... oh, two,    three years.
That's going to take a lot of man-   hours.  Is it really necessary?
You don't understand...
Let's just say I don't have your    sensitivity to the computer.
That's all right.  It doesn't matter.
Chief...
Forget it.  It's all right.
Chief, I want you to do what you    have to do.
Yessir.  Thank you, sir.  I'll get    on it right away.
And this is... Ops...
The heart and soul of Deep Space    Nine.  Ah, there you are, Commander...
Gentlemen, Madame Ambassador...
They insisted on seeing Operations,    sir...
Of course.  Please make yourself at    home.  I trust Doctor Bashir is taking    care of all your needs.
He refuses to change my    accommodations... if I have to sleep    another night on a Cardassian bed...    with those gargoyles staring at me    from the woodpoles...
Commander, unidentified vessel coming    through the wormhole...
Excuse me.       On screen.
You'll have a better view from over    here, Ambassador...
Quite a sight, isn't it?
That's it?  That's the whole thing?
Well, yes, it's...
I was expecting... more... somehow.
Scanners aren't picking up any    lifeforms on board.
A probe?
Might be.       I'm reading an extensive computer    array... but no signals that would    suggest it's trying to maintain    contact with a mother ship...
Are the computers compatible with    ours... ?
Hard to tell.  I don't recognize any    known subprocessor patterns.
The young woman obviously doesn't    have the necessary experience...    perhaps if I...
That young woman has over three    hundred years of experience,    Ambassador...
I might have better luck if we towed    it into the docking ring...
No.       Not until we know a little more about    it.  Major, tow it to five hundred    meters off the docking ring...
Yessir.
Mister O'Brien, try to set up an    adaptive interface link and see if    we can download any information from    it.
Aye, sir.
I think it would be best if we clear    this area...
But this probe may represent contact    with a new species...

I appreciate your interest,    Ambassador.  And to keep you all    fully informed, I'm scheduling a    briefing at oh-four hundred.  In the    meantime, Doctor Bashir, the best    view of this probe will be from the    docking ring near port seven...
I'll show them the way.
Such concentration.  Such intensity.     Such a passion for your work...    tracking intergalactic malefactors.
Most people find it rather tedious.

Tedious?  Those of us who have been    the beneficiaries of your heroism    would never call your work tedious.     We've learned that on this station,    you are the thin beige line between    order and chaos...
That's my job.
Now, what can I do for you... you    haven't lost anything else, I hope.
Only my heart.
I beg your pardon?
Is Odo your first or last name?
Yes.
Ah, then I can just call you...
Odo.
It has a certain lyrical quality.
Lyrical?
Odo.  It rolls... off the tongue.
I have a lot of work to do.
I'm told you're a shape-shifter.
That's correct.
I've never been with a shape-shifter.
"Been with... "?
I've heard you're the only one of    your kind.
So far.
All the men I've known... who've    needed to be shaped and molded and    manipulated.  Finally, I've met a    man who knows how to do it himself.
Was that the com... ?  I think it    was.  Excuse me, I'm wanted in Ops.
Initiating high-resolution scan...    memory nodes located... proceeding    with data transfer...
There you go... who woulda thought...
You seem surprised, Chief...
Yeah, well, knowing this computer, I    thought I'd have to reconfigure the    whole emulator module to get her to    be compatible with the probe... but    she's cooperating for a change...
Transfer of data is complete...
Well done, computer.
Computer, run standard code    translations on probe data... isolate    syntax results...
Processing, stand by.
Come in.
Yes, Odo...
Commander, I have a problem.
Quark again... ?
Nossir, this one's named Lwaxana.
Lwaxana Troi... the ambassador... ?
That's her.  There was a minor    incident at the bar that I helped    her with... and now... she's...    grateful.
What's the problem?
The manner in which she expresses    her gratitude.
To be honest, Commander, she seems    interested in me.
What's wrong with that?
She's extremely aggressive.
I see.  So, she's after you.
Like a Wanoni tracehound.
Have you thought of letting her catch    you?
Sir?
A little romance, Odo.

I have six pylons that need a complete    security sweep... I don't have time    for romantic interludes... frankly,    in my humble opinion, most of you    humanoids spend far too much time on    your respective mating rituals...
It does help the procreation of one's    species...
Procreation does not require changing    how you smell or writing bad poetry    or sacrificing various plants to    serve as tokens of affection... In    any event, it is all irrelevant to    me.
I'm sorry to hear that.
I would appreciate it if you would    do something about this woman.
Me?
Just tell her to leave me alone.
Constable, you can handle thieves    and killers but not one Betazoid    woman... ?
I understand thieves and killers.  I    don't understand... her.
I can't help you, Odo.
I'm just trying to avoid a diplomatic    incident.  I don't want to insult    the Ambassador.
A reasonable concern.  I suggest you    handle the matter with great delicacy.
I don't handle "delicacy" very well.
The probe appears to be made out of    some sort of corundium alloy...
Analysis of all sub-processor modules    is complete...
Already... ?  On screen.       Lieutenant...
No science modules... no    communications system... and enough    computer capacity to run a galaxy    class starship.  It's very odd.
That's an awful lot of computer    hardware to simply navigate a probe.
Anything?
Nothing that suggests the probe's    mission.
It's no trouble at all... we can    clear that headache up in a second...    when was the last time you had a    complete checkup?
Well, now that you mention it, I    probably could use a physical if you    could fit it into your schedule...
There you are, Odo.
Have you ever been on the fourth    moon of Andevian Two at dawn?
Can't say I have.
I have the most wonderful holo-program    and I've reserved a suite for us    with that Quark person...
You told Quark you were going into a    holosuite with me?
Of course.  He's preparing a special    picnic basket for us.
Good lord.
I'm afraid I'm not available.  I    have to get to upper pylon three    immediately.
Madame ambassador...
Lwaxana...       Upper pylon three.
I've always wanted to see an upper    pylon.
I know.  I'll have Quark send one of    his minions with our basket... we'll    have our picnic up there...
Madame Ambassador...
Lwaxana...

I don't eat... this is not a real    mouth... it is an approximation of    one... I don't have an esophagus or    a stomach or a digestive system... I    am not like you... every sixteen    hours, I turn into a liquid.
I can swim.
Computer... computer...
Odo to Ops!
Go ahead, Odo.
Ambassador Troi and I are stuck in a    Turbolift... what's going on.
Power to all the pylon turbolifts    has failed...
We're reading a turbolift failure,    Odo... we'll beam you out...
Locking on... prepare to transport...
Ready.
Energizing.
Well?
Looks like the transporter's down    too...
Dax to Chief O'Brien, please report    to Ops immediately.
Be patient, Constable.
We'll get you out as soon as we can.
Alone at last.
... electromotive coil functions    normal... load detection functions    normal.  Diagnostic complete.
I don't get it.  Every component of    the turbolift power net seems to be    operational.
We can't find anything wrong with    the transporter.
Great.  Everything's in working order    except nothing's working.
How do we get our people out of the    turbolift, Chief?
If we were on a starship, I'd reroute    the E-P-S power flow in a couple of    hours... but with this computer,    there's no telling how long it will    take...
Get it started...
Kira to Odo...
Yes, Major.
I'm sorry, but you'll have to stay    put awhile...
Define "awhile."
I wish I knew.
By the way, Cardassian turbolifts    run an exposed multi-phase alternating    current through their positioning    mechanisms, so don't try to shape-   shift your way out...
I wouldn't think of it.
Besides it wouldn't be polite.
I didn't hear that...
It wouldn't be polite.
Understood.  Kira out.
Do you suppose that we're actually    in any danger?
Not if we remain calm.
Then we might as well enjoy ourselves    and use the opportunity to get to    know one another.
I'd really prefer to pass the time...    quietly.
Quietly.
Quietly.
Of course.
Thank you.
The quiet man.
Hmmm.
I've always been attracted to quiet    men.  Odd isn't it?  But then, there    may be more truth than we realize to    the old axiom that opposites...
Quietly.
Odo...
Yes.
I don't think I can.
Can what?
You don't have to say a word as long    as we're here... but I do think I    need... to talk...
I understand.  There's nothing to be    afraid of.
Of course not.  It could be much    worse.
Really.

My daughter and I were once trapped    on a Ferengi cargo ship and it was    dreadful... well, all right, it wasn't    actually dreadful, it was mildly    lamentable.  And it was all because    that loathsome Daimon... well,    actually he wasn't altogether    loathsome, he was slightly repulsive,    but he did have a certain charm, in    an insufferable sort of way.  And of    course he was totally at the mercy    of his uncontrollable passion for    me.  So he couldn't have been all    bad, could he?  Well, it wasn't all    passion, there was some negligible    commercial interest involved, but    the passion was perfectly real, and    quite touching, in a way.  He was so    helpless.  At first it was totally a    question of expediency when I made    love with him...
... what are you looking at?
Hmm?  Oh... nothing... I was just    wondering how many volts are in that    exposed circuit... go on...
Well, quite frankly, by the time one    thing had led to another, I wasn't    at all sure that I would ever...
Another hour with them could destroy    my career.
It's a simple job.  Just keep them    happy and away from me.
Simple?  Nothing makes them happy.     They are dedicated to being unhappy    and to spreading that unhappiness    wherever they go... they are the    Ambassadors of Unhappy.
We've all had assignments like this,    Doctor.
Have you, sir?
As a matter of fact, Curzon Dax used    to take perverse pleasure in assigning    me to take care of VIP guests...
So, now, you take the same perverse    pleasure in doing it to me...
Exactly.
May I ask, sir, when you "graduated"    from this sort of assignment?
The day I hit one of the guests.
Hit one.
A minor misunderstanding over his    attempt to coax a young Ensign to    his quarters against her will.
Don't hit one of them, Doctor.  I'm    not nearly as understanding as Curzon    was.
Yessir.
Commander, can I talk to you...
It's the computer, sir.
Still giving you problems...
Nossir, that's just the thing.  It's    not.  It rerouted the E-P-S power    flow in less than an hour.
That's good news.  How soon can we    get Odo and the Ambassador out?
We can't.  It didn't activate the    Turbolift circuits.  Don't ask me    why.
You must have some idea what's    wrong...
(sighs, shrugs, doesn't     know)   I want you to listen to something --    computer, analyze Ops O-2 sensor    readings...
All sensors read between fourteen-   point-three and fourteen-point-four    K-S-C...
(Okay, I'll try it     again)   Computer, restart all shield generator    subsystems...
Shield generator subsystems set to    active status, reading ninety-eight    point three percent efficiency...
Do you hear it?
Hear what?
The voice.  It's not the same    attitude.
It sounds like the computer.
Sir, when you work with a computer
You think some kind of program from    the probe is influencing our    computer... ?

Well, it's got to be more than just    a program.  The computer's whole...    personality has changed.  She's    obedient, almost submissive... and    then there's this one other crazy    thing I'm almost afraid to mention...
What's that?
Every time I leave, something happens    to bring me back...
Bring you back?

To the computer.  Like the failures    of the Turbolifts and the    transporters... or a few minutes    ago, when I was working over at the    transporter pad, the com lines went    down... and when I broke for a quick    bite to eat, we had a replicator    failure... it's like the computer    doesn't want me to leave it alone.
You almost make it sound like... a    child.
What if it's some kind of non-   biological lifeform we've never seen    before... ?
Non-biological... ?
Well, it comes down to how we define    "lifeform"... but just as biological    organisms have evolved in our    cultures, mechanical life could have    done the same in others...
You're suggesting someone's left a    baby on our doorstep.
Possibly.
Do you think we could communicate    with it?
In a way, we already have... I mean,    it's part and parcel of our computer    now...
But as far as direct communication    is concerned, it may not be capable    of that.  We haven't seen any evidence    that this entity is sentient...
It may be more like a stray puppy    that's attached itself to you,    Chief...
Whatever it is, it's slowly disabling    our station, people... we've got to    get it out of there...
It came here when we downloaded the    probe's files.  If we uploaded the    same files back to the probe, it    might go with them.
What if it's fully integrated itself    into our computer... ?

I don't think it has.  That would    make it more like a virus... but I    don't see any evidence that it's    trying to overwrite our control    networks or destroy our systems.  I    think it's more likely that it simply    creates connections with areas of    the computer that are active...
Almost as though it feeds off the    energy of the computer functions...
If I'm right, transferring all of    its programming off the station just    might solve our problems...
Com lines have been down over ninety    minutes... he's been in there for    almost four hours now...
You happen to know the schedule of    his regenerative cycle?
My god... I have no idea... but if    he doesn't get back to his pail in    time...
Subspace emitter aligned... outgoing    data stream activated...
Computer, upload all probe command    sequences back to the probe's    computers...
Stand by.       Unable to complete requested function.     Please abort and retry.
Reset subspace emitter... reinitialize    data stream...
Receptors open... control relays    activated...
Upload all probe command sequences    back to the probe's computers...
Stand by.
It may not be quite as easy as I    thought, Commander.
Is it just the lights or the heat    too... I didn't bring any warm    clothes...
I'm sure it's just temporary...
I've been reading the reports of    your Chief of Operations, Doctor...    They gave me the impression that he    was a competent engineer...
Chief O'Brien?  One of the best in    Starfleet...
Then why aren't the backup systems    functioning?
Well, you know, out here on the edge    of the frontier, it's one adventure    after another... why don't I escort    you back to your quarters while we    all wait this out...
Well, enough about me.
Hmmm?
Enough about me.  Tell me about    yourself.
I'm really a private man.
Of course you are.  Is that hair    real?
It is real... in that it is me.  It    is not real hair.
How do you do it?       Your hair.
It took a great deal of practice.
You studied hairstyles?
If you must know, I imitated the    hairstyle of the Bajoran man who    was assigned to me...
Assigned?
To study me at the research center.     He was a scientist.
You mean that's where you grew up...    in a laboratory?
I didn't "grow up" as you think of    it.  It was merely a... transition...    from what I used to be to what I    learned to become...
Sounds very lonely to me.
I was always very self-sufficient.
I'm sure you had to be.       To survive.  Being so different from    everyone else.
Odo to Ops... Odo to Ops...       Com lines are still down... what's    taking so long?...
Are you all right?  You look warm.
It's nothing.  I'm fine.
I can't imagine how it must have    been.
If it bothers you to talk about it...
Not at all.  What was it like?  I    guess you could say I was... the    life of the party.
I'm not sure I understand.
My way of trying to fit in. I found    I could be entertaining.  Odo, be a    chair.  I'm a chair.  Odo, be a    razorcat.  I'm a razorcat.  Life of    the party.  I hate parties.
Maybe you've been going to the wrong    ones.
Come to one of mine, Odo.  I'll see    to it that all the guests are there    to entertain you...
You're not well.
No, I'm fine.  It's just... I told    you how I turn into a liquid every    sixteen hours?  Well, I'm in hour    fifteen...
We're ready, Commander...
How long do you expect it to take?
If it works, we ought to be able to    get all of the probe's files manually    transferred to the six isolinear    rods in less than sixty seconds...
Let's do it...
Computer, conduct a level one    diagnostic of all power systems on    board.
Requested function will require forty-   three minutes.  Stand by.
Computer, give me an analysis of all    Cardassian traffic along the border...
Processing long range sensors, stand    by...
Computer, create an historical data    base for all known wormhole    activity...
Time parameters...
All known occurrences...
Requested function will require    subspace link-up with Federation    computers.
Create a subspace link with Nehru    colony... New France colony... and    Corado One transmitter array...
Attempting link-up, stand by...
Computer, access musical files in    the Bajor master data banks and create    a concert program of Bajoran    serenas...
Stand by... unable to...
Stand by... unable to...
I'm reading a huge plasma surge in    the habitat ring...
You tell Commander Sisko that I expect    that probe briefing to be held on    schedule, lights or no lights...
I will surely pass that on, Amb...
We've got a plasma explosion in    corridor H-12-A.  Guest quarters.
The computer's not responding...    none of the fire suppression systems    are coming on-line...
I'm reading four lifeforms in that    corridor...
Major, with me!  Chief, send a message    to security -- get an emergency crew    down there.  We'll need manual fire    gear.
Aye, sir.
Phasers at maximum...
Toranium inlay... Cardassian design,    I should have guessed...       We're going to need a bipolar torch    to get through it...
And get a message to Ops -- tell    them it's going to take us awhile to    get inside... if they can't get the    fire suppression systems on-line...    we're gonna lose our people in    there...
It's not paying any attention to me.
I guess it just doesn't want to leave.     Like a scared puppy.

We have no idea how long that probe    was tumbling through space... maybe    years... with that lifeform alone on    board.  It's sort of like shutting    the puppy up in a room, you know?  I    had a pup once.  If I had to lock    him up, he'd scratch forever at the    door, trying to get out...
I'm not sure I know what you're    getting at...
Pups don't like to be left alone.     They like attention.
This one is certainly getting a lot    of it.
That's right, so it's no wonder it    doesn't want to leave.
Okay, but how does that help us?

Everything we've seen suggests this    entity likes to be where the action    is... it seems to feed on the energy    of an active computer.  We've been    trying to separate it from what it    thrives on... we've got to do the    exact opposite...
The exact opposite?
Lieutenant, I've got to build a    doghouse...
Odo to Ops.
Odo out.
Odo... turn around.
I can't.  It's beginning.
It's all right.
You don't understand.  No one has    ever seen me like this.
Not even the scientist who was    "assigned" to you?
That was different.  It was only a    matter of research to him.
You don't have to be ashamed with    me.
I am not ashamed.  It's a private    matter, that's all.
How can I make it easier for you...
You can't.  I'm fine.
What's that?
My hair.
Nobody's ever seen me like this.
Why?  It looks fine.
It looks... ordinary.  I've never    cared to be ordinary.       You see, Odo, even us non-shape-   shifters need to change who we are    once in a while.
You are not at all what I expected.
No one's ever paid me a greater    compliment.
I cannot hold my shape any longer.
Let go.  I'll take care of you.

We're going to need portable oxygen...    and get anything Bashir has in stock    to treat plasma burns...    (he exits, to a     security man)   Have a runabout ready to evacuate    these people to Bajor if we need    to...
Anara... ?
The subprogram is ready, Chief.
Computer, analyze subprogram labelled    "Pup"...
Requested subprogram is a series of    bi-directional data transfer and    monitoring commands.
Re-route all main computer backup    functions through this subprogram.
All backup functions re-routed.
Great.  Okay, Computer, now, listen    carefully, I want to transfer all    probe command sequences out of core    memory and into the subprogram "pup."
Stand by.       Transfer complete.
Dax to Sisko.  Fire suppression is    responding.  All systems are back on-   line.  Can you get in?
We're in, Dax.  Stand by...
We better... advise Starfleet Command.
Please, Julian.  Call me Taxco.
Are you all right?
Thanks to Julian.
The doctor was remarkably calm and    logical for a man of his years under    such severe conditions.
We'll be putting him in for a    commendation.
Nice work, Doctor Bashir.
Right place at the right time.
It's about time.
I know that wasn't exactly what you    had in mind for your picnic.
When it comes to picnics, the only    thing that really matters is the    company.
Your discretion and sensitivity are    appreciated.
Next time you see me, I'll give you    a lot more to appreciate.
How'd you beat that thing in the    computer, Chief?
I didn't.
He adopted it.
Adopted it?
I was able to get our friend out of    the main command pathways and into a    subprogram.
You're not suggesting we leave it in    there.
I don't see why not.  It's happy.     Not bothering us any more.  Seems to    be the humane thing to do.
It's just another new lifeform    visiting the station.
I'll look after it, sir... make sure    it's getting enough attention and    all...
Keep it off the furniture.
Yessir.
